SEARCH
Package Control.Tool

Class ControlUtils

java.lang.Object
Control.Tool.ControlUtils
public class ControlUtils extends Object
Utility class providing common helper methods for control layer operations.

This class contains static utility methods for parsing boolean-like strings, managing CSV file initialization, and handling CSV field escaping/unescaping. All CSV operations use proper quoting to handle special characters (commas, quotes, and newlines) within field values, ensuring data integrity.

CSV Format: All fields are wrapped in double quotes. Internal quotes are escaped by doubling them (e.g., "He said ""Hello""" represents: He said "Hello"). This follows RFC 4180 CSV standards.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Allen

  • Constructor Details

    • ControlUtils

      private ControlUtils()
      Private constructor to prevent instantiation of this utility class.

  • Method Details

    • parseBooleanLike

      public static Boolean parseBooleanLike(String s)
      Parse common boolean-like strings into Boolean. Returns Boolean.TRUE / Boolean.FALSE, or null if unable to parse.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to parse
      Returns:
      Boolean.TRUE if the string represents true, Boolean.FALSE if it represents false, null otherwise

    • ensureCsvPrepared

      public static void ensureCsvPrepared(String filePath, String header) throws IOException
      Ensure a CSV file exists with the given header and that the file ends with a newline. If the file does not exist or is empty, it will be created with the header followed by a newline. If the file exists and does not end with a newline, a newline will be appended.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      header - the header line for the CSV file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • ensureTrailingNewline

      public static void ensureTrailingNewline(String filePath) throws IOException
      Append a newline to the file if the last byte is not already a newline ("\n"). Treats '\n' as the definitive newline marker; supports CRLF by accepting '\r' before '\n'.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • escapeCsvField

      public static String escapeCsvField(String field)
      Escape a CSV field by wrapping it in double quotes and escaping any internal quotes. This ensures that commas, newlines, and quotes within the field don't break CSV parsing.
      Parameters:
      field - the field to escape
      Returns:
      the escaped field wrapped in quotes, or empty string if field is null

    • unescapeCsvField

      public static String unescapeCsvField(String field)
      Unescape a CSV field by removing surrounding quotes and unescaping internal quotes. This reverses the escaping done by escapeCsvField. All fields are expected to be quoted.
      Parameters:
      field - the field to unescape
      Returns:
      the unescaped field

    • splitCsvLine

      public static String[] splitCsvLine(String line)
      Split a CSV line while respecting quoted fields that may contain commas. This properly handles fields wrapped in quotes.
      Parameters:
      line - the CSV line to split
      Returns:
      array of fields with quotes removed where appropriate
